bug.short_desc: Some time the Graphics stop works while Browsing web sites

assigned_to.name: Nobody; OK to take it and work on it

long_desc.thetext:
User-Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0 Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0) Gecko/20100101 Firefox/4.0
While browsing web sites ,the Graphics stop work suddenly. The former version didn`t have this situation. Add to say, using other Browser does`t has this situation. I `m not sure it whether it was caused by firefox, but every time it happens i was browsing web site with firefox 4.0
ATI Mobility Radeon HD 3400 Series - <Event xmlns="http://schemas.microsoft.com/win/2004/08/events/event"> - <System> <Provider Name="Display" /> <EventID Qualifiers="0">4101</EventID> <Level>3</Level> <Task>0</Task> <Keywords>0x80000000000000</Keywords> <TimeCreated SystemTime="2011-04-04T12:48:19.000000000Z" /> <EventRecordID>36402</EventRecordID> <Channel>System</Channel> <Computer>liuxx-PC</Computer> <Security /> </System> - <EventData> <Data>amdkmdap</Data> <Data /> </EventData> </Event>
Reproducible: Didn't try

Is your Issue reproducible when you disable the Hardware Acceleration and restart Firefox? If yes, please post the Content of the Graphics Section you can get via "about:support" after you re-enabled Hardware Acceleration.
Hardware Acceleration is not supported by my PC
(In reply to comment #2) So what does the Graphics Section look like?

ATI Mobility Radeon HD 3400 Series I can do nothing but wait, then a few seconds later, it`s ok. note: this happaned when i opened about 6 websites(not everytimes i did this). Maybe it`s due to my Graphics Section. But every time it occurred, i was browsing websites with firefox, with IE this did not happend.I don`t kown why ,and puzzled. I have been using firefox about four years. And if it can start up faster, it would be perfect.
Errmm, please post the Graphics Information you can get via "about:support" or alternatively choosing "Help"/"Troubleshooting Information" with enabled Hardware Acceleration.
